name: scrnaseq-comprehensive
title: Single-Cell RNA-seq: Comprehensive Gene Expression Analysis
description: Advanced single-cell RNA sequencing analysis pipeline supporting multiple aligners (simpleaf, kallisto, STARsolo, cellranger) with flexible protocol and barcode whitelist configuration for 10x Genomics, DropSeq, and custom single-cell platforms. Perfect for discovering cellular diversity and gene expression patterns.
content:
üß¨ Single-Cell RNA-seq: Comprehensive Gene Expression Analysis

Discover Cellular Diversity Through Gene Expression

Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) reveals the unique gene expression profile of individual cells, uncovering cellular heterogeneity, developmental trajectories, and rare cell populations that traditional bulk RNA-seq cannot detect.

üéØ Aligner Selection Guide

Choose the optimal alignment approach for your experimental design:

üìä simpleaf (Alevin-fry) - Recommended

  • üöÄ Ultra-fast: Lightning-speed quantification with Alevin-fry

  • üéØ Protocol flexibility: Define custom chemistries like 1{b[16]u[12]x:}2{r:}

  • üìã Barcode control: Use trusted whitelists [WL‚úì] or auto-derive [WL‚úó]

  • ‚úÖ Best for: Most single-cell experiments, especially 10x data

üî¨ kallisto|bustools

  • ‚ö° Efficient: Pseudoalignment-based quantification

  • üß¨ Protocol support: Pre-defined protocols (10xv3, dropseq) or custom layouts

  • üìã Whitelist support: Use known vendor whitelists [WL‚úì] or derive from data [WL‚úó]

  • ‚úÖ Best for: Research requiring specific protocol customization

‚≠ê STARsolo

  • üéØ 10x optimized: Native support for 10x protocols (V1-V4)

  • üßÆ Comprehensive: Full alignment with detailed mapping statistics

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Whitelist limitation: Whitelist alone insufficient for non-10x custom layouts [WL‚úó]

  • ‚úÖ Best for: 10x Genomics datasets requiring full alignment

üè¢ cellranger/cellrangermulti/cellrangerarc

  • üè≠ Industry standard: 10x Genomics official pipeline

  • üîß Automated: Protocol detection and optimization

  • üìä Multimodal: Supports feature barcoding and multi-omics

  • üö´ Whitelist: Feature/multiplex barcodes are separate inputs (not cell CB whitelist) [WL‚úó]

  • ‚úÖ Best for: 10x data requiring official processing

üß¨ Reference Genome Selection

Choose from a comprehensive collection of reference genomes including:

  • üßë Human: GRCh37, GRCh38, CHM13, hg19, hg38 - optimized for human single-cell studies

  • üê≠ Model Organisms: Mouse (GRCm38, GRCm39, mm10, mm39), zebrafish, fly, C. elegans

  • üå± Plants: Arabidopsis, rice, maize, sorghum - plant single-cell genomics

  • üêÑ Livestock: Cow, pig, horse, chicken - agricultural and veterinary applications

  • üß´ Microbes: Yeast - single-cell microbiology research

All genomes include curated gene annotations for accurate quantification and downstream analysis.

üìã Barcode Whitelist Strategy

Understanding When and How to Use Whitelists:

  • üéØ Trusted Whitelists [WL‚úì]: Use known, kit/lot-specific CB lists for reproducibility across runs

    • Enforce a fixed barcode set

    • Best for: Production pipelines, standardized protocols

    • Supported by: simpleaf, kallisto

  • üîÑ Auto-derive from Data [WL‚úó]: Let algorithms discover barcodes dynamically

    • Adapts to actual data characteristics

    • Best for: Exploratory analysis, unknown barcode distributions

    • Supported by: All aligners

  • üìä Expected Cells: Guide cell calling with approximate cell count estimates

    • Not a whitelist, but helps optimize calling thresholds

    • Supported by: All aligners

üß™ Protocol Configuration Examples

Standard Protocols:

  • 10XV1, 10XV2, 10XV3, 10XV4 - Standard 10x Genomics chemistries

  • dropseq - Drop-seq protocol

  • auto - Automatic detection (cellranger only)

Custom Chemistry Strings:

  • simpleaf: 1{b[16]u[12]x:}2{r:} (16bp barcode, 12bp UMI)

  • kallisto: 0,0,16:0,16,26:1,0,0 (R1: 0-16bp barcode, 16-26bp UMI; R2: all read)

üìã Sample Sheet Format

Your CSV samplesheet defines the experiment structure:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,expected_cells
control_rep1,control_1_R1.fastq.gz,control_1_R2.fastq.gz,5000
control_rep2,control_2_R1.fastq.gz,control_2_R2.fastq.gz,5000
treated_rep1,treated_1_R1.fastq.gz,treated_1_R2.fastq.gz,4500
treated_rep2,treated_2_R1.fastq.gz,treated_2_R2.fastq.gz,4500

üìä Comprehensive Results

Gene Expression Data

  • üìä Count Matrices: Gene √ó cell expression matrices in H5, MTX formats

  • üè∑Ô∏è Cell Metadata: Quality metrics, cell type assignments, filtering statistics

  • üß¨ Feature Data: Gene annotations, mitochondrial content, expression summaries

Quality Control

  • üìà MultiQC Report: Comprehensive analysis summary with interactive plots

  • üîç Cell-level QC: UMI counts, gene detection, mitochondrial percentages

  • üìä Sample Comparisons: Batch effects, sequencing depth, technical metrics

Analysis-Ready Outputs

  • üßÆ Seurat Objects: Ready for downstream analysis in R

  • üêç AnnData Files: Compatible with scanpy and Python ecosystems

  • üìä Visualization Files: UMAP/t-SNE coordinates and cluster assignments

Perfect for Research in: Developmental biology ‚Ä¢ Cancer research ‚Ä¢ Immunology ‚Ä¢ Neuroscience ‚Ä¢ Plant biology ‚Ä¢ Stem cell research ‚Ä¢ Drug discovery ‚Ä¢ Tissue engineering
